blogPosts.title: Create A Whitelisting Application
blogPosts.excerpt: Learn how to develop a whitelisting application for approved wallet addresses, commonly used in NFT mints or token airdrops.

content.text: Many projects, whether for an NFT mint or a token airdrop, employ whitelisting of approved wallet addresses. In this guide, we will create an application that whitelists connected wallets.
The Smart Contract
To start, clone the following repository from GitHub and rename it to 'whitelist-app':
Navigate to the 'hardhat' subdirectory and initialize a Node.js project. Then, install Hardhat:

content.code:
cd whitelist-app/hardhat
npm init --yes
npm install --save-dev hardhat

content.text: Set up a new Hardhat project:
When prompted, select 'Create a JavaScript project' and accept the default settings.
